com.comphenix.protocol

Class PacketType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.comphenix.protocol.PacketType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PacketType
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents the type of a packet in a specific protocol.

    Note that vanilla Minecraft reuses packet IDs per protocol (ping, game, login), so you cannot rely on IDs alone.

    Author:
    Kristian
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PacketType.Handshake
      Packets sent during handshake.
      static class  PacketType.Legacy
      Contains every packet Minecraft 1.6.4 packet removed in Minecraft 1.7.2.
      static class  PacketType.Login
      Packets sent and received when logging in to the server.
      static class  PacketType.Play
      Packets sent and received when logged into the game.
      static class  PacketType.Protocol
      Represents the different protocol or connection states.
      static class  PacketType.Sender
      Represents the sender of this packet type.
      static class  PacketType.Status
      Packets sent and received when querying the server in the multiplayer menu.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static java.lang.Iterable<PacketType> values()
        Find every packet type known to the current version of ProtocolLib.
        Returns:
        Every packet type.

      • findLegacy

        public static PacketType findLegacy(int packetId)
        Retrieve a packet type from a legacy (1.6.4 and below) packet ID.
        Parameters:
        packetId - - the legacy packet ID.
        Returns:
        The corresponding packet type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the legacy packet could not be found.

      • findLegacy

        public static PacketType findLegacy(int packetId,
                    PacketType.Sender preference)
        Retrieve a packet type from a legacy (1.6.4 and below) packet ID.
        Parameters:
        packetId - - the legacy packet ID.
        preference - - the preferred sender, or NULL for any arbitrary sender.
        Returns:
        The corresponding packet type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the legacy packet could not be found.

      • hasLegacy

        public static boolean hasLegacy(int packetId)
        Determine if the given legacy packet exists.
        Parameters:
        packetId - - the legacy packet ID.
        preference - - the sender preference.
        Returns:
        TRUE if it does, FALSE otherwise.

      • findCurrent

        public static PacketType findCurrent(PacketType.Protocol protocol,
                     PacketType.Sender sender,
                     int packetId)
        Retrieve a packet type from a protocol, sender and packet ID.

        It is usually better to access the packet types statically, like so:

        • PacketType.Play.Server.SPAWN_ENTITY
        Parameters:
        protocol - - the current protocol.
        sender - - the sender.
        packetId - - the packet ID.
        Returns:
        The corresponding packet type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the current packet could not be found.

      • hasCurrent

        public static boolean hasCurrent(PacketType.Protocol protocol,
                 PacketType.Sender sender,
                 int packetId)
        Determine if the given packet exists.
        Parameters:
        protocol - - the protocol.
        sender - - the sender.
        packetId - - the packet ID.
        Returns:
        TRUE if it exists, FALSE otherwise.

      • fromLegacy

        public static PacketType fromLegacy(int id,
                    PacketType.Sender sender)
        Retrieve a packet type from a legacy ID.

        If no associated packet type could be found, a new will be registered under LEGACY.

        Parameters:
        id - - the legacy ID.
        sender - - the sender of the packet, or NULL if unknown.
        Returns:
        The packet type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the sender is NULL and the packet doesn't exist.

      • fromCurrent

        public static PacketType fromCurrent(PacketType.Protocol protocol,
                     PacketType.Sender sender,
                     int packetId,
                     int legacyId)
        Retrieve a packet type from a protocol, sender and packet ID.

        The packet will automatically be registered if its missing.

        Parameters:
        protocol - - the current protocol.
        sender - - the sender.
        packetId - - the packet ID. Can be UNKNOWN_PACKET.
        legacyId - - the legacy packet ID. Can be UNKNOWN_PACKET.
        Returns:
        The corresponding packet type.

      • fromClass

        public static PacketType fromClass(java.lang.Class<?> packetClass)
        Lookup a packet type from a packet class.
        Parameters:
        packetClass - - the packet class.
        Returns:
        The corresponding packet type, or NULL if not found.

      • hasClass

        public static boolean hasClass(java.lang.Class<?> packetClass)
        Determine if a given class represents a packet class.
        Parameters:
        packetClass - - the class to lookup.
        Returns:
        TRUE if this is a packet class, FALSE otherwise.

      • scheduleRegister

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> scheduleRegister(PacketType type,
                                                              java.lang.String name)
        Register a particular packet type.

        Note that the registration will be performed on the main thread.

        Parameters:
        type - - the type to register.
        name - - the name of the packet.
        Returns:
        A future telling us if our instance was registered.

        Parameters:

        legacyId - - the legacy packet ID.

      • isClient

        Determine if this packet was sent by the client.
        Returns:

      • isServer

        public boolean isServer()
        Determine if this packet was sent by the server.
        Returns:
        TRUE if it was, FALSE otherwise.

      • getCurrentId

        public int getCurrentId()
        Retrieve the current protocol ID for this packet type.

        This is only unique within a specific protocol and target.

        It is only unknown if the packet was removed in Minecraft 1.7.2.

        Returns:
        The current ID, or UNKNOWN_PACKET if unknown.

      • getPacketClass

        public java.lang.Class<?> getPacketClass()
        Retrieve the equivalent packet class.
        Returns:
        The packet class, or NULL if not found.

      • getCurrentVersion

        public MinecraftVersion getCurrentVersion()
        Retrieve the Minecraft version for the current ID.
        Returns:
        The Minecraft version.

      • getLegacyId

        public int getLegacyId()
        Retrieve the legacy (1.6.4 or below) protocol ID of the packet type.

        This ID is globally unique.

        Returns:
        The legacy ID, or UNKNOWN_PACKET if unknown.
